III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The two buildings are located of the grounds of Vista Maria. Vista Maria has a very
large campus in western Wayne County. There are several programs on campus. This
license is being issued to the mental health buildings, which are Rose Hall and Beata
Hall. Both buildings are new with very sophisticated monitoring systems in the units and
in the behavioral management rooms. The girls have individual rooms and the common
areas are designed for easy supervision of the residents. Rose Hall was previously
under license CI820201488 After some discussion with the child welfare licensing
consultant the facility decided to move both mental health programs under the same
license.
B. Program Description
The Vista Maria mental health, (Rose and Beata Halls), program provides services to
residents ages 11-17 in a secure setting. Residents attend an on grounds school.
Rose Hall has a classroom within the building. Children receive group and individual
therapy. A large number of the residents also receive the services of the agency
psychiatrist including prescriptions and medication monitoring. Both buildings are
designed to meet the needs of girls who are in need of an extremely structured
environment.
